summary:
I am an ambitious, results-oriented young academic professional with perseverance. By nature I am interested in people and what drives them, how they interact with others, and in the influence of culture on human behaviour. I get satisfaction from conducting social science research, from performing problem analyses, the search for durable solutions, optimizing processes and writing advisory reports, preferably within a multidisciplinary and international team. To succeed in finalizing a (research) project within the set time frame, gives me an energy boost!

My way of working is characterised by enthusiasm, commitment, a social attitude and an analytical way of looking at things. Other people appreciate my systematic approach, organizational skills, proactive attitude and critical point of view.

Work aspects that are important to me are: 1) contributing to society / social relevance; 2) contact with other people; 3) change and variety; 4) personal development; 5) career opportunities.

Contact: apmnuijten@gmail.com

projects.title: DG Dinner: DisGover Europe
projects.description: With the aim to organize an interesting and entertaining evening for the network of DisGover, nine other DisGover trainees and I are planning the so-called 'DG Dinner: DisGover Europe’, which will take place at the end of March 2017. During this dinner, which is based on the well-known 'Correspondents’ Dinner', serious substantive and provocative issues regarding Europe will be discussed and combined with elements of humour and entertainment. By organizing the 'DG Dinner: DisGover Europe’, we want our guests to contemplate ‘Europe’ and other issues that are related to this theme. During this event we are going "Back to the drawing board!" and try to redefine which values are important to us when it comes to Europe. Do we want to increase the power of supranational European institutions or do we want to decentralize the power back to member states?

projects.title: Ballast: Big Annoyances About Small Things Among Scientific Employees
projects.description:
The experienced workload has increased in recent years at the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences at Utrecht University. This is evident from the staff monitors. A number of actions have already been undertaken to cope with the increased workload, such as more formation and assistance in education. There are, however, other smaller processes or activities that cause feelings of pressure or that cause annoyances. The shared kitchen has not been cleaned up, the endless stream of emails about leave registration, etc. 

This project was about 'big annoyances about small things' within the framework of the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences and about how these annoyances can potentially be addressed. A top 3 of annoyances with possible solutions has been composed and handed over to the management team, in the form of an advisory report.

contributors.headline: Manager Operations Wageningen Food Safety Research at Wageningen University & Research

projects.title: Strengthening Research Support Offices
projects.description:
The objective of our Utrecht University Project was mainly to formulate functional and quality requirements for Research Support Offices and the University Administrative Department to ensure that researchers from Utrecht University are optimally supported in acquiring external funding, also in light of the new framework programme Horizon 2020 and the increasing demand for valorisation.

We also gave advice on the necessary expertise and capacity in faculties and the University Administrative Department and we gave advise on optimizing the cooperation and coordination within a department, between departments and with the University Administrative Department and external services. In addition, we developed indicators to effectively measure / monitor the service quality of the research support offered by Research Support Offices and the University Administrative Department.

projects.title: Bereavement Protocols and Protocols Crisis Situations Abroad
projects.description: This project team was set up in order to draw up a bereavement protocol for students (done by Erline Rood), a bereavement protocol for employees (done by Iris Bleeker-Beers) and protocols with regard to students and staff members who find themselves in crisis situations abroad (done by myself).

projects.title: Safe Third Country
projects.description: This project addressed the question "What is a Safe Third Country?". This question plays a role within the current discussion regarding the return of refugees from Greece to Turkey, in which Turkey is considered to be a 'safe third country'. Crucial questions here are, "Can Turkey be considered a 'safe third country' in terms of its conditions and circumstances?" and "Can this be ensured from the perspective of European and international law?".

contributors.headline: Manager Data Privacy bij KPMG Nederland

projects.title: Sustainable Business Operations: Low Hanging Fruit
projects.description:
The project Low Hanging Fruit is a sub project of the project Sustainable Business Operations. Utrecht University is increasingly concerned with sustainability and has included sustainability in its Strategic Plan 2012-2016 as one of the four strategic issues facing Utrecht University in the coming years. In its own operations, the university wants to gradually reduce its ecological footprint. The starting point is a good balance between People, Planet and Profit (also known as the three P's).

The sub project Low Hanging Fruit is concerned with an inventory of what has already been done and what can still be done within the field of small sustainability, at the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences. Firstly, with the goal to contribute to the sustainability of the faculty within a short time amount, and secondly to demonstrate the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences staff what sustainability measures have already been undertaken and what measures / activities will be done before the end of 2015.

projects.title: Vluchtelingendata.nl
projects.description: The aim of this project was to objectively show all kinds of data on the migration flow on a central online platform. With this, our intention was that the public debate on the refugee crisis would be based on facts rather than opinions and inaccuracies. In cooperation with relevant parties in the field of Open Data and Refugees, questions that prevailed among the society were interpreted, definitions were redefined and the data was made presentable in the form of articles and infographics.

projects.title: Ways of Working: Project Management
projects.description: This project was set up because all non-academic staff of the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences from Utrecht University had to follow the training Project Management. Three different training courses were offered: one for the management team, one for project leaders and one for project officers / members.
